docs.snippet: American football is a violent game, but one that is beloved like no other. Would soccer be more popular in the United States if it were more rough-and-tumble? Purists say we are missing the point....
docs.lead_paragraph: American football is a violent game, but one that is beloved like no other. Would soccer be more popular in the United States if it were more rough-and-tumble? Purists say we are missing the point.
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column questions whether soccer would be more popular in the United States if it were more violent; says people are drawn to big hits and midair collisions, like vicious hit on Brazil's Neymar by Colombia's Juan Camilo Zuniga at the World Cup, play that was reminiscent of scenes in the National Football League.
